channel.title: Enviromental variables
channel.description: Hello! Thank's for taking a look at this. To start off i would just like to say, that i have looked at many tut's and have not figured it out. Call me retarded idc. Anyway, I just got a new laptop for christmas, and want to host a new server on it. I have window's 7, downloaded jdk, and set the enviromental variable's. Still cannot run a compiler. Please help? I have teamviewer.

item.title: Enviromental variables
item.dc:creator: @Itz-austin Itz-austin.
item.description:
@Itz-austin wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:4, topic:375162”][quote author=Itz-austin. link=topic=471125.msg3445574#msg3445574 date=1293408984]

What directory did you install it to?

Install what? jdk, the source, or team viewer lmfao?
[/quote]Are you sure the ‘compiler’ (I’m assuming it’s just a batch script) is actually calling java via the environmental variable, or is it trying to hard-code the path to the executable?

e.g. is it:

javac *.java

or is it

"C:/Program Files/Java/JAVA_VERSION/bin/javac.exe" *.java

It was just a batch file. I figured it out, thanks for trying to help/taking your time to read/post tho Happy holiday’s hope you got what you wanted for christmas

PS: Mod can lock this.

Read full topic

item.title: Enviromental variables
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

[quote=“Itz-austin., post:3, topic:375162”][quote author=TOMSCAPE BETA link=topic=471125.msg3445529#msg3445529 date=1293405457]
What directory did you install it to?
[/quote]

Install what? jdk, the source, or team viewer lmfao?[/quote]Are you sure the ‘compiler’ (I’m assuming it’s just a batch script) is actually calling java via the environmental variable, or is it trying to hard-code the path to the executable?

e.g. is it:

javac *.java

or is it

"C:/Program Files/Java/JAVA_VERSION/bin/javac.exe" *.java

Read full topic
